sub_title: Manager / Software Engineer / Solution Architect at KPMG Tech Advisory
summary: Experienced Software Engineering Consultant with a demonstrated history of working in the IT and business consulting industry. Skilled in various programming languages and architectural design principles.  Strong academic background with an honors awarded Master of Science (MSc) in Software Engineering from the University of Amsterdam Faculty of Computer Science.

awards.title: Best International Speaker
awards.description:
I received this award for a solo presentation I gave in English. This was part of an international education event and was attended by over 150 international students and 20 faculty members. The students and faculty were from both my university and from universities in Germany, Brazil, Turkey, and Denmark.
 
At the end of the presentations, the audience (students and faculty) voted for the best speaker.

awards.title: Best Project
awards.description:
My project group received this award for having the best out of the 15 contributions during an international education event with students from several international universities. Our group consisted of eight people and formed a plan to use the Dutch monumental windmills as a modern power source. 

At the end of the event, the audience (students and faculty) voted for the best project.

awards.title: Best Speaker
awards.description:
As part of my undergraduate degree in Architectural Engineering, I completed several general education courses. One of these was a course focusing on learning to present yourself and give presentations. As a final project in this course, we presented our individual projects to all 80 students in the course. 

At the end of the presentations the attending faculty members chose the best presenters.

projects.title: Graduation
projects.description:
Before graduation with my Bachelor’s degree, I completed a final project. We conceptualized a system for harvesting and storing solar energy in containers filled with Phase-Changing Materials (PCM). The versatile harvester can be placed in front of a window or even the entire façade of a building. Depending on the size of the harvester and storage containers, this system is capable of storing enough warmth and cold  to maintain a stable indoor temperature (summer & winter) without the need for external power.

My biggest achievement in this project was a simulation program I wrote to prove and predict how the system would work. The program require the dimensions of the harvesting system and would then simulate the harvesting process using historical weather data collected hourly by the Royal Dutch Meteorological Institute (KNMI).

contributors.headline: Manager / Software Engineer / Solution Architect at KPMG Tech Advisory

projects.title: Minor Modeling and Simulation
projects.description:
As part of my undergraduate work, I completed a minor in Modeling and Simulation. The first half of the minor focused on math and programming courses. The goal of these courses was the creation of mathematical models to simulate behaviors of different objects.

The second half of the minor consisted of a project with a company partnering with the HvA. Using their simulation engine we created a 3D model of our school building and simulated the evacuation procedures in the event of a fire. The simulation engine provided algorithms to simulate how people move through a space. However, due to the limited interface and usability of the engine, I built my own framework around the engine in C#. This allowed us to create and run scenarios quickly. We were also able to use the actual time-table of the school to simulate the actual evacuation process at any given time during the day. As a final benefit, we were able to manipulate the 3D building model quickly and with ease.

contributors.headline: Manager / Software Engineer / Solution Architect at KPMG Tech Advisory

profile_positions.description: Part of the Tech Advisory team with a focus on Software Architecture, Quality and Development.
profile_positions.title: Manager

profile_positions.description:
As a Software Engineering consultant with KPMG, I work within the entire scope of the software engineering process. In addition to building and designing applications and landscapes, I advise clients on improving existing software and development processes using Agile and CI/CD principles. Another area of focus is in IT due-diligence and software quality engagements which includes helping clients gain a better understanding of company acquisitions and potential future improvements on technical strategies as well as making build/buy decisions. 

Since starting with KPMG I have been active in following roles amongst others:
- Lead Engineer / Scrum Master
- Software Quality researcher
- IT/Business consultant (requirements engineering / acceptance criteria / product selection)  
- Software Developer
- Proposals / Sales related activities.

As an engineer I have worked professionally with the following technologies amongst others:
- Microsoft: .NET, MSSQL, Azure
- Open Source: Java, PHP, Python
- JavaScript (TypeScript): Node.js, React(Native), Angular(4)(JS) 
- (Arch)Linux, Docker, Vagrant, Jenkins, GitLab CI
profile_positions.title: Consultant (Software Engineer) Technology Advisory

profile_positions.description:
Master Thesis on Agile. Agile/Scrum is often chosen as a tool to provide a project/program with execution power by its short iterations and focus on working software. But how can we see if a software development project in Scrum is going well? Thesis was rewarded with an 8.0, graduated with honors/cum laude.

During my research I found that feedback generated in Scrum predominantly provides information about execution and solution. But not about added value, constraints and in limited sense about capability.

My thesis is grounded in a 75 million Euro project at a client of KPMG. I analyzed in total eight sprints, four teams, conducted various interviews and observed day-to-day work over a period of three months.

The contribution of this thesis was twofold. It made make clear how dicult it is in a large, complex change program to see if the program is on schedule. Additionally, it showed that, while Scrum is a solution-oriented approach, and as such brings the problems in realization clearly into view, it does not perform well with management on value and the programs constraints. The second contribution of this thesis was a clear analysis how to extend Scrum to make these risks assessable, by adding a light weight governance layer.

Grade: 8.0.
profile_positions.title: Intern IT Advisory

profile_positions.description: In addition to my studies I have advised, installed and maintained all the IT-Solutions at Pri-Bo. The network I setup consists of 3 CAD-workstations, a general purpose workstation and a server that hosts file-storage, backups and printers/plotters. Currently I occasionally maintain their systems and keep them up-to-date.
profile_positions.title: IT Consultant

profile_positions.description:
In the spring of 2015, I completed an internship with ABN-AMRO's Center of Expertise Software Development. This internship proved to be a broad introduction to the IT field in a multinational corporation as well as additional experience in software engineering. During this internship, I explored the structural quality (source-code) of several software applications within ABN-AMRO's processes. While the initial assignment was to create reports for senior management by using a static-code analyzer, I quickly discovered this approach was not the best way to report on overall software quality.

In order to provide senior management with a complete overview of software quality, I devised a method for implementing application life-cycle management. This process consists of tracking an application from beginning to end which provides vital intelligence about the connections between the total-cost of ownership as well as the quality of an application to both internal and external entities. The method works by implementing various quality checks between each phase an application goes through during its life cycle. Aside from measuring quality, these checks are also able to actively manage quality to the desired level.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineering Internship

profile_positions.description:
During my second year at the Hogeschool van Amsterdam (Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences), I interned at the engineering firm Witteveen+Bos. In this role, I spent half of my time on the architectural engineering component of the recently-finished APM-Terminals in the Port of Rotterdam. During this project I was responsible for creating technical drawings and gathering the requisite documents and calculations for obtaining a building permit.

For the second half of the internship, I focused on a new development within the company building parametric computer models. These parametric models where proof of concepts for tools that can aid in making decisions within large and complicated projects.  The creation of these tools inspired my interest in software-engineering.
profile_positions.title: Building Engineering Internship

profile_positions.description: I worked at an international internship in Castellón de la Plana, Spain for four months. The internship was with an architectural firm specializing in luxury vacation villas along the Spanish coast of the Mediterranean. I was responsible for developing 3D models to help architects visualize their plans and show the impact of design-decisions. In the month prior to the internship, I attended an intensive Spanish course in Spain. This experience allowed me to develop cross-cultural communication skills and gain valuable experience in working with people from around the world.
profile_positions.title: Building Engineering Internship

profile_positions.description: At this electronics store, I was responsible for selling desktops, laptops, and computer accessories. Due to my affinity for both hardware and software, I became the “go-to” computer technician. In this role, I installed and repaired computers for our clients at either our store or their home and cultivated excellent customer service skills.
profile_positions.title: Computer Sales Associate & Computer Repair Technician
